Song.title: Sooner Count The Stars
Song.copyright: © 2015 Sovereign Grace Worship Music & Words by Doug Plank and Steve & Vikki Cook

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [||: C#m | A | E | E :|| (2x)]
VERSE 1: I could sooner count the [C#m]stars{,} than [A]number all Your [E]ways Though I only know in [C#m]part,{,} that [A]part exceeds all [E]praise As [A]sunlight fills the [E]skies{,} Your [F#m]goodness fills my [C#m]life For [A]all Your precious [C#m]gifts{,} receive my [B]grateful[E]ness [(intro)]
VERSE 2: I could sooner drink the [C#m]seas{,} than [A]fathom all Your [E]love Like a never ceasing [C#m]stream{,} are [A]mercies through Your [E]Son The [A]death of Christ al[E]one{,} de[F#m]serves eternal [C#m]song For [A]such a love as [C#m]His{,} receive my [B]gratefuln[E]ess [| E]
CHORUS: No [B]praise is high enough,{,} no [C#m]thanks is deep enough No [A]life is long en[E]ough{,} to tell of [B]all You’ve done No [B]shout is loud enough,{,} no [C#m]words are strong enough No [A]song is sweet en[E]ough{,} to sing Your l[B]ove [| B (intro)]
VERSE 3: I could sooner turn back [C#m]time{,} than [A]turn Your heart a[E]way Though the years go fleeting [C#m]by,{,} Your [A]mercies never [E]change Be[A]fore You made the [E]sun{,} Your [F#m]love was set on [C#m]us For [A]all Your faithful[C#m]ness{,} receive my [B]gratefuln[E]ess
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 i could sooner count the stars than number all your ways though i only know in part that part exceeds all praise as sunlight fills the skies your goodness fills my life for all your precious gifts receive my gratefulness verse 2 i could sooner drink the seas than fathom all your love like a never ceasing stream are mercies through your son the death of christ alone deserves eternal song for such a love as his receive my gratefulness chorus no praise is high enough no thanks is deep enough no life is long enough to tell of all youve done no shout is loud enough no words are strong enough no song is sweet enough to sing your love verse 3 i could sooner turn back time than turn your heart away though the years go fleeting by your mercies never change before you made the sun your love was set on us for all your faithfulness receive my gratefulness
